upperBoundMethods

Class AndersenBroadieUpperBoundEstimation

  • java.lang.Object
    • upperBoundMethods.AbstractUpperBoundEstimation
      • upperBoundMethods.AndersenBroadieUpperBoundEstimation
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    BermudanSwaptionValueEstimatorInterface

    public class AndersenBroadieUpperBoundEstimation
extends AbstractUpperBoundEstimation
    Implements the Andersen-Broadie method of martingale approximation using sub-simulations.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Lennart Quante

      Constructors

      This method creates a new model with a changed starting and final date and initializes the LIBOR rates according to the given path of the input model.

    • Constructor Detail

      • AndersenBroadieUpperBoundEstimation

        public AndersenBroadieUpperBoundEstimation(AbstractLowerBoundEstimation lowerBoundMethod,
                                           int pathsSubsimulationsStepA,
                                           int pathsSubsimulationsStepB)
        Parameters:
        AbstractLowerBoundEstimation - lowerBoundMethod The lower bound method to be used as a basis for the upper bound.
        pathsSubsimulationsStepA - number of subsimulation Paths in case 2a of A-B algorithm, i.e. if exercise at current simulation time.
        pathsSubsimulationsStepB - number of subsimulation Paths in case 2b of A-B algorithm, i.e. if no exercise at current simulation time.

    • Method Detail

      • createSubsimulationModelTerminating

        public net.finmath.montecarlo.interestrate.LIBORModelMonteCarloSimulationModel createSubsimulationModelTerminating(net.finmath.montecarlo.interestrate.LIBORModelMonteCarloSimulationModel model,
                                                                                                                   int startingPeriod,
                                                                                                                   int endPeriod,
                                                                                                                   int component,
                                                                                                                   int numberOfSubsimulationPaths)
                                                                                                            throws net.finmath.exception.CalculationException
        This method creates a new model with a changed starting and final date and initializes the LIBOR rates according to the given path of the input model.
        Parameters:
        LIBORModelMonteCarloSimulationModel - to be used
        startingPeriod - Period when the new model should start.
        path - Path of the original model to be used for starting values.
        pathsOfSubsimulation - Number of paths for the new model.
        Returns:
        The model to be used for subsimulations.
        Throws:
        net.finmath.exception.CalculationException
